title: cursor blinking rate
body: Type: Feature Request Need to add cursor blinking rate (0 to 10) feature for more customization. VS Code version: Code 1.78.2 (b3e4e68a0bc097f0ae7907b217c1119af9e03435, 2023-05-10T14:39:26.248Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.19045 Modes: Sandboxed: Yes

title: Spurious warning that "changes will be lost" when closing a file immediately after saving

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: git
labels.description: GIT issues

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: N/A (GitHub Codespaces and GitPod workspaces each require an extension) - VS Code Version: 1.78.2 - OS Version: macOS Ventura 13.4 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open a GitHub Codespace or a GitPod workspace in VS Code for macOS. 2. Open a file for editing, or run run a `git` operation that waits on file edit (like `git commit`), and make any edit to the file. 3. Press âŒ˜S followed by âŒ˜W (or correspondingly on non-macOS platforms). Expected: The file is saved and then closed. Observed: VS Code warns that "Your changes will be lost if you don't save them." When using `git`, it's extremely common to save a file and then follow that by immediately closing it. This means that I run into a spurious warning many times a day. I don't recall any instance where the file was *not* actually in the process of a successful save by the time the warning pops up. I assume that this issue occurs because the round-trip to confirm the save is not fast enough when using a codespace/workspace, compared to a typical local file save. Would it be possible to fix this by doing one of the following? - Avoid showing the warning if a file save request was just issued. - Maybe show a warning if it turns out the save failed? - Introduce an action for "save and close". - Possibly with a default chorded shortcut of âŒ˜S âŒ˜W? Apologies if this is a duplicate issue, or in the wrong repo. I've been experiencing this issue for a long time (a year or two), but I haven't seen other issues for it yet.

title: Expose a way for an extension/webview access to the file icon theme
body:
Treeview's can use the `resourceUri` property on an item to have VS Code provide the appropriate themed file icon, but there is no way outside of that for an extension to get access to the appropriate icon for a `Uri`, ideally for use in a webview.

Here is our example use-case. In GitLens we've switched files in our treeviews to show the themed file icon and a decoration for its status (similar to the SCM view), but we can't get those same icons in our Commit Details view since it is a webview.

![image](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/assets/641685/cd733732-1c43-466c-ae24-19716eb3505b)

/cc @aeschli

title: Extension debugging has regressed significantly recently
body:
Version: 1.79.0-insider
Commit: 784e72bc4486b7ea5ad3447c506e31d949848592
Date: 2023-05-30T05:20:59.861Z
Browser: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Code-Insiders/1.79.0-insider Chrome/108.0.5359.215 Electron/22.5.4 Safari/537.36

Unfortunately, it's hard to pin this down to a set of steps, but I've (along with other fellow dev) have been experiencing an array of regressions that I believe have started in 1.79.

Here are some of the symptoms:

- Stop button stops working or takes a VERY long time -- often seems to get stuck on Webviews, but sometimes it won't even stop but the call stack view shows nothing.
- Stop button sometimes actually kills the debugger window -- just disappears, but leave the debuggee open
- Restart button often works the first or second time, but then stops
- Breakpoint sometimes fail to be hit (and require a VS Code restart), but replacing with a `debugger;` call works
- Variable hovers sometimes fail to show values, and sometimes show the editor hover rather than variables

Some of these issues feel like things we had in the past (like 6-9mo ago) and feel like that are back.

It definitely feels like webview debugging makes things worse.

Also in today's insiders, additional issues with when starting debugging that kicks off the default build task, sometimes it now shows a task picker, rather than just running the default task -- and a VS Code restart fixes it. And it usually starts after stopping a debugging session.

title: The Learn More button of build-in NPM support for VS code extensions goes to a page that does not exist.
body:
<!-- âš ï¸âš ï¸ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template âš ï¸âš ï¸ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- ðŸ•® Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- ðŸ”Ž Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- ðŸ§ª Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- ðŸ’¡ Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- ðŸ”§ Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No
No, specify a build-in extension
<!-- ðŸª“ If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- ðŸ“£ Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.78.2
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.19045

### This is a bug about the build-in extension of **NPM support for VS code**
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make sure your TypeScript/JavaScript project folder has multiple lockfiles like `package-lock.json` and `pnpm-lock.yaml`.
2. Make sure your `@ext:vscode.npm` extension is the default setting.
3. Open `package.json`, mouse hover on one of any scripts, and click the "**Run Script**" button on the popup widget.
4. Then you will have a notifications window like this :
![Snipaste_2023-05-31_09-33-10](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/assets/60378434/89194f61-ec3a-47e4-9509-9a24b90fcb82)
5. Click the "**Learn More**" button.
6. Will automatically open an URL of `https://nodejs.dev/learn/the-package-lock-json-file` which is "PAGE NOT FOUND".

Found the code at line 143 in `VSCODE/extensions/npm/src/task.ts`:
 ```TypeScript
window.showInformationMessage(multiplePMWarning, learnMore, neverShowAgain).then(result => {
switch (result) {
	case neverShowAgain: extensionContext.globalState.update(neverShowWarning, true); break;
	case learnMore: env.openExternal(Uri.parse('https://nodejs.dev/learn/the-package-lock-json-file'));
}
});
```

title: Prepend and append seem to replace the value on Linux on bash
body:
Testing #182970

I have code that calls `replace('myvar3', '3')`, then `append('myvar3', 'append')`, then `prepend('myvar3', 'prepend')`. When I echo `myvar3`, I only see `prepend`. Same if I run `env`.
The options are `applyAtProcessCreation: true` and `applyAtShellIntegration: false`.

Edit: Same issue when I re-enable shell integration, set both options to true, and re-run the extension.

<!-- ðŸª“ If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- ðŸ“£ Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: Version: 1.78.2
Commit: b3e4e68a0bc097f0ae7907b217c1119af9e03435
Date: 2023-05-10T14:39:26.248Z
Browser: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Code/1.78.2 Chrome/108.0.5359.215 Electron/22.5.2 Safari/537.36

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install Jupyter extension
2. Make a dummy extension and install it:

```typescript
export function activate(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
		context.subscriptions.push(
			vscode.languages.registerSignatureHelpProvider('python', {
				provideSignatureHelp(document, position, token, context) {
					return {activeParameter: 0, activeSignature: 0, 
					signatures: [{
						label: "foo",
						parameters: [{label: "v"}],
						documentation: "aaaa",
					}]};
				},
			}, {triggerCharacters: ["("], retriggerCharacters: [","]}));
		}
```

```json
	"activationEvents": [
		"onLanguage:python"
	],
```
2. Create Interactive Window
5. Enter `import datetime; datetime.date(`
6. Nothing shows up
7. Press `Ctrl+Shift+Space`
8. Nothing shows up
9. The signature help works on new `.py` files though, just not in the interactive.

title: Status bar is highly unstable in vscode-server-insiders
body:
<!-- âš ï¸âš ï¸ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template âš ï¸âš ï¸ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- ðŸ•® Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- ðŸ”Ž Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- ðŸ§ª Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- ðŸ’¡ Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- ðŸ”§ Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: N/A (See Note Below)

<!-- ðŸª“ If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- ðŸ“£ Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: Version: 1.79.0-insider (Universal)
Commit: 784e72bc4486b7ea5ad3447c506e31d949848592
Date: 2023-05-30T05:22:58.126Z (14 hrs ago)

- OS Version: macOS Ventura 13.3.1

Note: While this issue does involve extensions, the issue seems to be an issue with vscode-server-insiders more generally, thus my reporting the bug here.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install any one of various status bar extensions (Bottom Terminal, Activitus Bar, Workspace Name in Status Bar, et cetera)...
2. Status bar is consistent across restarts & reloading of windows.
3. After connecting to remote machine, status bar seems randomly to ignore certain extensions. This is inconsistent across restarts & reloading of windows. When hiding / showing certain status bar items, others seem to appear.
5. Uninstalling & reinstalling vscode-server-insiders on the Host machine does not resolve the issue.

Has anyone else seen this? Again, this does not seem to be an issue with any one particular extension, but with vscode-server-insiders itself. Also noteworthy is that the instability does not occur in any way with vscode-server stable.

title: Test: Notebook & Cell level CodeActions
body:
Refs: #179213 

- [ ] anyOS @jrieken 
- [x] anyOS @ulugbekna 

Complexity: 3

--- 
## Summary:

Notebooks now support CodeActions being run upon save. One extra CodeActionKind has been introduced for CodeActions that apply to the entire scope of the notebook, editing multiple cells (i.e., extracting imports to a top cell, grouping %pip install's, etc.). Source level CodeActions are also supported on an individual cell level. These run in parallel so they are restricted to only editing the resource that is passed to it (the TextDocument of the cell the provider is called upon).

For Notebook Level CodeActions, the provider is only passed the FIRST cell of the notebook, as to not return CodeActions that need to resolve for each cell. Keep this in mind if you choose to create your own provider/action.

## Steps to Test:

**note: testing Notebook level CodeActions will require OSS, or tomorrow's (05/31) insiders build

- Download or create your own extension, creating a provider for both cell/source and Notebook CodeActions
  - [This](https://github.com/Yoyokrazy/clean-nb-imports-ext) is a sample extension that has the two providers
- Launch the extension host 
- Create a new or open a pre-existing notebook
  - [This](https://github.com/Yoyokrazy/ipynb-playground) is a playground I use with a couple messy notebooks that can be tested on.
- Go to Settings (UI) and search for `notebook.codeActionsOnSave`, and add your CodeActions.
  - If you use the sample extension, your settings.json should include something like this to test both Cell and Notebook levels:
```json
"notebook.codeActionsOnSave": {
	"notebook.cleanImports": true,
	"source.fixAll": true,
},
```
- Save the document, triggering the CodeActions. May be easier to ensure they work individually by commenting one or the other CodeAction within your settings, then testing them combined at the end.


## Things to check
- CodeActions are applied correctly, the changes desired are applied without error. 
- The notebook is clean and saved after all CodeActions are applied.

## If you want to do more
- Create a source level CodeAction that applies edit to multiple cells. This should FAIL and not apply, due to the restriction of only editing the given cell/resource

--- 
Thanks so much for testing!

title: switching profiles with dirty untitled notebook will disable dirty indicator

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body:
Testing #183534

1. create a new notebook and make an edit
2. switch profiles to restart the EH
3. save the file when prompted and provide a file name: `saved.ipynb`
The untitled-n.ipynb tab remains open, rather than opening saved.ipynb, 
:bug: The file is no longer marked dirty, even with futher edits and **can be closed without prompting to save**

title: fix [object Object] in invalid decorator warning
body:
when there's an invalid decorator, you get a warning like this:

```
[warning] INVALID decoration from extension '[object Object]': Error: The decoration is empty
```

as is done elsewhere in this file, should use `extensionId.identifier.value` to get a string

Fixes #183839

* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->

title: Invalid decoration warning says `[object Object]`

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Issues identified as good community contribution opportunities

labels.name: polish
labels.description: Cleanup and polish issue

body:
<!-- âš ï¸âš ï¸ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template âš ï¸âš ï¸ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- ðŸ•® Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- ðŸ”Ž Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- ðŸ§ª Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- ðŸ’¡ Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- ðŸ”§ Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- ðŸª“ If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- ðŸ“£ Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 60bfd19

Steps to Reproduce:

1. provide an invalid decoration in `provideFileDecoration`
2. see warning in ext host logs that says `[object Object]` instead of the extension name:

```
[warning] INVALID decoration from extension '[object Object]': Error: The decoration is empty
```

title: Tree checkbox API: Improve `manuallyManageCheckboxSelection`

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: tree-views
labels.description: Extension tree view issues

body:
Testing #183549

It's difficult to know what `manuallyManageCheckboxSelection` dooes without reading the docs.

From what I observe, this setting is that whether the checked state of a parent node is based on the checked states of the (visible) children.

maybe the name can be `syncCheckboxSelectionWithChildern`
